result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Gerrit Vanoordt

records.addlTxt: No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1. Do not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons. Defendant must notify Clerk of Courts of current/updated address within 24 hours of release from custody.

9:19 AM Defendant Richard Gerrit Vanoordt in court.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes concerns about competency based on the defendant's actions at the initial appearance and notes defendant has not yet gotten an attorney. Defendant indicates that he will not be looking to get an attorney. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney and options for counsel. Defendant notes that he has troubles reading in front of people and speaking in front of counsel. Court asks if the defendant has competency issues. Defendant notes that he is competent in a spiritual sense. Defendant lives on his own but is homeless. Defendant notes that he received a masters degree in 2005, notes strengths in getting along with others. Notes his family can provide a phone number, notes that his family is present in court. State also notes that the victim is present and would like the no contact order lifted or amended to violent or abusive contact. State reviews timelines for competency evaluation. Court makes finding there is reason to doubt the competency of the defendant. Outpatient evaluation will be ordered.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard Gerrit Vanoordt
Current: Homeless, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 09-27-2022)
Prior: 7258 S Cty Tk P, Hawthorne, WI 54849

No contact with victim 1 as listed in ID or their address.  No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. Defendant must notify Clerk of Courts of current/updated address within 24 hours of release from custody. May return one time with law enforcement to retrieve personal property.

3:05 PM Defendant Richard Gerrit Vanoordt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State indicates there will be a no contact with the address listed on the complaint and requests an alternate address.  Defendant indicates that he does not have an alternate address. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant declines to have Mr. Hoffman represent him.
Defendant enters a no contest plea; Court explains what a no contest plea is. Court enters not guilty plea(s) on defendant's behalf. 
State requests 750 sb No contact with victim 1 or address listed on the complaint. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. 
Defendant has no response.
Court orders $750 sb 
Victim 1 wishes to address the court; supports requested conditions.
Court orders conditions of bail- No contact with victim 1 as listed in ID or their address.  No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. Defendant must notify Clerk of Courts of current/updated address within 24 hours of release from custody. May return one time with law enforcement to retrieve personal property. 
Court reiterates that he may not go back to that address and may not have contact with those parties except for the one time with LE.
Defendant makes statements to Court.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed Order to Seal ID Key
